messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] spells
messages.msgSnippet: In ps spelled with X  on it equals miss-spelled. But a missed spell could be either a faulty spell or one that manifests in the wrong place or perhaps s spell
messages.messageBody:
In ps spelled with X on it equals miss-spelled. But a
missed spell could be either a faulty spell or one
that manifests in the wrong place or perhaps s spell
to casting of which one arrived too late, or perhaps
the venue was miss-placed, miss-represented,
miss-read, or even miss-spelled. We might take a spell
and spout a speil of spells, spellings and special
spoofs. And of course X marks the spot.

Sharon

messages.subject: spells and the X-spells
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/5/01 9:50:45 PM Mountain Daylight Time, ... OH good one! King s X from being X-spelled! King s X  is an old sign-of-the-cross type
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/5/01 9:50:45 PM Mountain Daylight Time,
ddzimlew@... writes:


> I bet you can guess the reaction! If she was in ps she'd probably be
> expelled.

OH good one!

King's X from being X-spelled!
"King's X " is an old sign-of-the-cross type thing. It always saved me from
being tagged, even though there was no king and I was neither English nor
Catholic. Some magic lives through the centuries.


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
